body:
> some of the tests need to be re-adjusted 

yes, I will fix the tests soon.
I still have to rebase this PR once #869 is merged as it will fix `AdminTest.brokerStats(AdminTest.java:567)` test.

> Isn't it better to have atleast one info log per connection? Else we will not be able to find out if client is connected.

Yes, there's another info line at https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/client/impl/ConnectionPool.java#L157
retest this please
I think we don't have a testcase for dedup..right?
Resolved by #812

@rdhabalia There's a test class at https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/d4a8c25bc00bc1d61e1a1f5b4ee34566cdacfe3d/pulsar-broker/src/test/java/org/apache/pulsar/client/api/ClientDeduplicationTest.java
retest this please
I think the problem was the key we are passing for ordering was incorrect. I am closing this PR and will open with correct fix.
Please let me know if there are any other good ideas :)

As be pointed out on the issue, I think it's a bug in pulsar command. It doesn't respect what user set to PULSAR_EXTRA_OPTS.

Usage says,
```
PULSAR_EXTRA_OPTS             Extra options to be passed to the jvm
```
but it is completely overwritten by pulsar_env.sh.

If we are going to resolve the issue with this change, we should remove the line from the usage.

[another failure](https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar-pull-request/org.apache.pulsar$pulsar-broker/666/testReport/junit/org.apache.pulsar.broker.namespace/NamespaceServiceTest/testSplitMapWithRefreshedStatMap/)


@rdhabalia Is there a way to only prevent C++ partitioned consumers?

> Is there a way to only prevent C++ partitioned consumers?

Ummm..If we want to prevent only consumers then we have to do validation only when client tries create consumer. Now, only way to figure out client type(java/cpp) is to check `clientVersion` which was only introduced in [1.18](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/387) so, there is no deterministic way to find out client type/version when broker create a consumer because this information is not present in ServerCnx.

Now, I was thinking if is there any way we can determine it based on `subscription-name` and `partitioned-topic index` pattern. eg. Do a validation on pattern subscription-name `subX` and topic-name `-partitions-X`. If `X` matches then we can do validation. However, it also does not provide deterministic way to find out if request comes from old-client if sub-name ends with digit. For example:
eg:
Check: `subX`, `partitions-X` matches?
- sub-name: sub : 
Old client: `sub1, topic-partitions-1 -> Pattern matches` Reject if topic is partitioned?: Reject
new client: `sub, topic-partitions-1 -> Pattern doesn't match`. Pass
- sub-name: sub1: 
Old client: `sub11, topic-partitions-1 -> Pattern matches ` Reject if topic is partitioned?: Reject
new client: `sub1, topic-partitions-1 -> Pattern matches` Reject if topic is partitioned? Reject-[x]
- sub-name: sub11: 
Old client: `sub1111, topic-partitions-11 -> Pattern matches` Reject if topic is partitioned? Reject
new client: `sub11, topic-partitions-11 -> Pattern matches` Reject if topic is partitioned? Reject-[x]

> have to do validation only when client tries create consumer. Now, only way to figure out client type(java/cpp) is to check clientVersion which was only introduced in 1.18 so, there is no deterministic way to find out client type/version when broker create a consumer because this information is not present in ServerCnx. 

I think we have that info in the `ServerCnx`, no? That's how we report the client version for each consumer.

If an older C++ consumer is not sending the version.. well that falls into the "< 1.21.0" category, right?

> I think we have that info in the ServerCnx, no? That's how we report the client version for each consumer.

I am not sure which version we are thinking but  we have two fields in `ServerCnx`:
1. `remoteEndpointProtocolVersion` : it's just a protocol-version eg. V1, V2 which doesn't tell broker about lib-type : java/cpp
2. `clientVersion`: This place-holder was introduced in [1.18](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/387) so, we can't depend on it as java-client before 1.18 was not passing and cpp is still not passing.
Got it. uhm.. :)

> Add encrypted field to CommandProducer 

Is there any plan to ensure the producer is effectively encripting all the messages? Or should we just check at the producer creation time?

Without checking every message metadata, producer may still publish
unencrypted messages.

We could fail the publish at the client, if encryption_required policy is
set but producer is failing to encrypt. Even then, it'll be client side
logic and not necessarily catch anyone bypassing this rule.

`MessageMetadata` has information on encryption: https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/df56dc981e8a298b30e832d641747ebcd45ded30/pulsar-common/src/main/proto/PulsarApi.proto#L73-L78

I think checking messages metadata is a better option, since we are already
deserializing message metadata.

We could add a config option on whether to start bookie component in same process as broker, also with bookie auto-recovery as well. 

In any case, we should just point the bookie to `conf/bookkeeper.conf` without having to import the same config keys into `broker.conf`

Pulsar is composed of several apps (such as bookie, broker, monitor) together. But currently it only support to have one universe package for one app. Sadly, We may not able to do it currently.

Universe package could be treat as a wrap on Marathon. Marathon supports starting multiple apps from one json, which called a "[Marathon Application Groups](https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/application-groups.html)", this json is submitted to [/v2/groups endpoint](https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/rest-api.html#post-v2-groups).

However, the [Cosmos (the DC/OS package manager)](https://github.com/dcos/cosmos/) doesnt accept the same request, because it only accepts request for /v2/apps endpoint from [this code](https://github.com/dcos/cosmos/blob/master/cosmos-server/src/main/scala/com/mesosphere/cosmos/MarathonClient.scala#L26), which is starting a single app.

There was already an [issue](https://github.com/mesosphere/universe/issues/569) opened to request a supporting for this group work in DCOS.
would like to left this issue tracking the DCOS package supporting work, and open another issue #924 for the marathon app groups work.
And ZK too. For small prod deployments,(eg: 2 broker, 3 BK system), running 5 ZK servers is too much.
